title: Kyle Rittenhouse Trial Continues With Opening Arguments Over Killings During Unrest
sub_head: Homicide case stems from protests against police shooting in Kenosha, Wis.
body:
KENOSHA, Wis.â€”Prosecutors described Kyle Rittenhouse as a tourist attracted to chaos in their opening statement in the trial of the Illinois teenager who killed two people and injured a third during unrest in August 2020 following the police shooting of Jacob Blake.
Mr. Rittenhouse, now 18 years old, faces charges of intentional, reckless and attempted homicide, as well as reckless endangerment, a curfew violation and possession of a firearm as a minor. His attorneys have argued self-defense and entered a not guilty plea. He has been free on $2 million in bail, mostly raised by supporters online.
